summary: This is an email chain between prosecutors and investigators discussing the status of FBI 302 interview reports and handwritten notes for the Epstein case. It references missing documents for specific interviews, including one with Jean Luc Brunel, and indicates there were over 120 interviews conducted.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of an FBI 302 interview dated 2019-07-08. An attachment of his interview 302 is referenced.

events.title: FBI Interview of Jean Luc Brunel
events.description: An FBI 302 interview was conducted with Jean Luc Brunel.

events.title: FBI Interview (Subject Unnamed)
events.description: An FBI 302 interview was conducted with an unnamed individual.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain about tracking FBI 302 interview reports and notes for the Epstein investigation.
It references an interview with Jean Luc Brunel on July 8, 2019, and attaches the corresponding 302 report.
The correspondence indicates there were over 120 interviews conducted in the case.
The emails show efforts to reconcile which interviews had formal 302 reports and which had accompanying handwritten notes, with several gaps identified.
